title: Heidrun Expansion Upgrades - Part 1
description: Heidrun is an amazing tool to enable custom application integration with Cardano, but the current supported functionality limits app scope

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is to add 3 functions relating to tracking Native payments to an existing open-source system that allows easy addition of ADA payments triggers linked to actions for developers. The question must be asked now that we have moved into the time of smart contracts, whether this type of functionality that requires trust and runs offchain is the best way for developers to go forward with this type of functionality.
It should be noted this $20k proposal is one of 4 proposals totaling $85k each adding 1 to three functions
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer created the initial software and is asking for funding to increase functionality. There is no reason to thing they won't be able to deliver. However the plan is 3 months to plan who to implement then another 3 months to deliver. That implies the proposer has not yet planned how to deliver this project which implies some risk on successful delivery. It would be nice to see a breakdown justification of the budget. How many hours of work does the proposer believe implantation of these 3 functions will take?
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is a simple deliverable of 3 additional functions, in that sense it is easy to audit delivery. The metrics for success should have some clear goals as to how many implementations using the functions would be considered a success.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal meets the challenge and it will help developers set up automated airdrops or payments faster.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers already have a well tested working model and given their experience it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal lists an open source GitHub repo which makes this proposal easy to audit.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal aims to improve an already functional product and to attract more people to use it and could beneficial for Cardano ecosystem. However, the solution presented lacks in addressing the non-English speakers, as there is no clear intention, at this moment, to add app's internationalization ('i18n').

The solution, based on above statement, doesn't align with the challenge settings. Maybe this proposal will fit better in another Fund Challenge (Dapps & Integrations).
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has the necessary experience to improve the app as he is its developer. The proposer knows, in an identifiable manner, the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal.

The budget is not broken down in identifiable items. (i.e. details for expenses with salaries, stationary and other necessary resources). A timetable to complete the work is presented but not in a clear manner ('after 3 months the implementation plan will be complete' - this statement is vague, is better to use identifiable working stages - module developing, testing, production etc.; 'after 12 months we would like to see numerous new applications utilizing these' - again, a vague statement, the success can be measured by defining  KPIs/metrics - i.e. 500/month new unique app's downloading 100/month new unique app's users etc.).

The proposer has not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation (what if the app isn't functional after 3 months? what if the impact to new users doesn't reach the aimed level? etc.)
f6_assessments.q2: Unfortunately the solution doesn't fit in the challenge settings. No KPIs/metrics are defined to achieve the goal of the proposal. The info presented makes the proposal difficult to asses.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal will add three functionality to the existing Heidrum package, which performs predefined actions whenever some event actions happen in tracked Cardano wallet. The three new actions will trigger events like Dropping ADA/Native assets on a predefined wallet activity. This has a potential to create additional use-cases for the package. The software is currently being used in IoT-based open Wifi hosting project Asosia.  The additional features have will open up new use cases for Native tokens.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have created the Heidrun, and therefore they should be capable of adding additional features to the package. The software is reportedly being used. Hence it is likely it is being maintained.
f6_assessments.q2: The quantum of coding involved has not been quantifying as it gives an impression that adding native assert to the original package may not require three months of development effort. The project, however, has a specified three deliverables and the software developed will be in the open domain. Hence the progress can be audited.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is similar to 3 other projects of this team in this Fund. They are all based on a Fund 3 proposal that is already in progress. This proposal seeks for funding to add further methods and functionality to this API (native token payment functionality). Therefore, it lays within the challenge. To further understand the impact on the proposal, the team could have added more context about how it adds value compared to other initiatives.
f6_assessments.q1: This team has already proven their skills in building on Cardano. Both are active in many community initiatives and therefore it is very likely that they will deliver this proposal as promised. They know their stuff. Providing more technical details would help to understand the provided plan in more detail. The budget is for compensation the developers. Providing more context (how many man hours?) would further help to assess if the budget is adequate.
f6_assessments.q2: A cleary defined deliverable within a timeframe is provided, as well as a source for documentation (Github). To improve the reviewability, I recommend adding a certain number of new applications that will run with Heidrun after 12 month instead of saying "numerous". In summary, they provide us with enough information to review this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Heidrum platform is already available to Cardano developers that makes integration of applications simpler. Adding functionalities to this platform as this proposal states, will help on developer adoption and productivity. Definitively this proposal is aligned with the goal of the Challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: There's a clear definition of the deliverables that are three new functions to the current Heidrum platform. The team have already shown expertise building this platform and with other fund challenges. Also, budget and timeliness are well defined for this development. For those reason the successfulness of this proposal can be guaranteed.
f6_assessments.q2: As there's a well defines scope of work, with due dates and allocated budget for development, 	the transparency and auditability of this proposal cab be assured.

solution: Expanding Heidrun to add new functionality support will rapidly expand the breadth of applications and target pool of builders on Cardano.
experience: Quinn and Kyle are both seasoned developers with a track record of success. Adosia delivered the first iteration of Heidrun.
